comments.body:
We may want to promote this file to the `lib/` dir (instead of being in `lib/src/`). `lib/` is API public, and `src/` means internal impl. It'll make it easier for us to know which APIs to be careful about.

If we do that, we should demote some things which are currently library public in this file to private.
Good idea.  I'll do it as a follow-on CL to keep the diff more sane (the splitting of the API vs the rejiggering of files)
Sounds good. If you're using the API, we want to make refactorings of the public API much more mindful, which I think means promoting the public api bits to `lib/`.
Too bad the type checker can't enforce these.
This is actually magic syntax for the analyzer as of 1.14.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +100,104 @@}

Iterable/*<T>*/ _generateValues/*<T>*/(
  Map/*<String, T>*/ assetDescriptor,
  String key,
